CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 24, 1960, pg. A19, reads: "CONTEST WINNERS - Last Sunday, Sept. 18, winners were announced, and awards made to participants in bartenders and waitresses, at Pappy Day's farm. Shown above, right to left are: Winning waitress, Marguerite Jeep, Williams Colonial Inn; runner-up, Grace Lumpkins, 600 Bar, Homestead; Emily Jeffrey, who received the Hi-Fi; George E. Pitts, master of ceremonies; winning bartender, James (Shimmy) Bandy, Parker's Grill; runner-up, Bill Paige, Williams and Luck, East Liberty.  Tabulations in this contest will be released in next week's edition of The Courier. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women and men, winning waitresses and bartenders, including Marguerite Williams on left, Grace Lumpkins, Emily Jeffrey, emcee George C. Pitts, James "Shimmy" Bandy holding trophy inscribed "1960's Most Popular Bartender James 'Shimmy' Bandy", and Bill Paige, standing possibly in Pappy Day's Farm
